message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The high chloride concentration in the sweat test indicates cystic fibrosis, which has an autosomal recessive mode of inheritance. Among the options, only the accumulation of glycogen in the lysosome is inherited in an autosomal recessive manner, as seen in Pompe disease. The other options are inherited in different ways, such as X-linked dominant (for abnormal production of type IV collagen in Alport syndrome) and mitochondrial inheritance (for mutated gene for mitochondrial-tRNA-Lys in MELAS syndrome).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The elevated chloride concentration in the sweat test indicates cystic fibrosis, which is inherited in an autosomal recessive manner. Among the options, only the accumulation of glycogen in the lysosome is also inherited in an autosomal recessive manner, seen in disorders such as Pompe disease.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's high chloride concentration in the sweat test suggests cystic fibrosis, which is inherited in an autosomal recessive pattern. Among the options, only accumulation of glycogen in the lysosome has the same mode of inheritance, as it is also inherited in an autosomal recessive pattern.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The high chloride concentration in sweat indicates cystic fibrosis, an autosomal recessive disorder. Among the options, only accumulation of glycogen in the lysosome is an autosomal recessive disorder, specifically Pompe disease. The other options are either X-linked or autosomal dominant.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms in the patient suggest cystic fibrosis, which is an autosomal recessive disorder caused by mutations in the CFTR gene, resulting in abnormal chloride transport across cell membranes. Among the options, only (A) accumulation of glycogen in the lysosome is also inherited in an autosomal recessive pattern. The other options have different modes of inheritance.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The high chloride concentration in the sweat test suggests cystic fibrosis, which is inherited in an autosomal recessive manner. Among the options, only the accumulation of glycogen in the lysosome is also inherited in an autosomal recessive manner, as seen in Pompe disease. Inability to convert carbamoyl phosphate and ornithine into citrulline has an X-linked recessive inheritance pattern in ornithine transcarbamylase deficiency, abnormal production of type IV collagen has an X-linked dominant inheritance pattern in Alport syndrome, and mutated gene for mitochondrial-tRNA-Lys has a mitochondrial inheritance pattern in MELAS syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The elevated chloride concentration in the sweat test suggests cystic fibrosis, which is inherited in an autosomal recessive manner. Among the options, only accumulation of glycogen in the lysosome is inherited in the same manner.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The elevated chloride concentration in the sweat test suggests cystic fibrosis, which is inherited in an autosomal recessive pattern. Among the options, only accumulation of glycogen in the lysosome is also inherited in an autosomal recessive pattern (ex. Pompe disease).

Among the options, only accumulation of glycogen in the lysosome in Pompe disease is also inherited in an autosomal recessive manner. The other options have different modes of inheritance.

Among the options, only the accumulation of glycogen in the lysosome (Pompe disease) is also inherited in an autosomal recessive pattern.
